TITLE: Mastrangelo: How Columbus Day Became a Holiday to Combat Racism Against Italian Americans
SUMMARY: The origins of Columbus Day -- commemorating Italian explorer Christopher Columbus -- stem from efforts to combat racism against Italian immigrants, who endured everything from racial epithets to lynch mobs when they first arrived to the United States. Today, in the era of wokeness, Italian Americans face a new type of mob, one that seeks to ban the federal holiday celebrating Italian heritage.
